result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua G. Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain fulltime employment, schooling and when not fully engaged, must complete 15 hours of community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. 

No contact with S.P.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

AODA and follow up.  Counseling as recommended by agent.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

timeConds.notes: SERVE 30 days jail with huber for work, school, treatment or combination.  No objection to EMP.  STAY 60 days jail.  Credit to be applied to conditional time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua G. Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 9:45 am 
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Austin Mort; Other appearances: Victim appears in back.
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Battery-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (DC)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

Victim makes statement from the back.

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Battery-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> Sentence W/H- 2 year probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Restitution in the amount of $200 to be paid by 11/12, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, AODA and follow up, Counseling as recommended by agent, No Contact with S.P., Good faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant has 45 days to report. COURT finds 8 days credit to be applied to conditional time.

Ct. 2 (DC)>> Sentence W/H- 2 year probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: 90 days MCJ but STAY 60 and SERVE 30 w/Huber for work/school/treatment or a combination, No objection to EMP, Restitution in the amount of $200 to be paid by 11/12,  Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, AODA and follow up, Counseling as recommended by agent, No Contact with S.P., Good faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant has 45 days to report. COURT finds 8 days credit to be applied to conditional time.

Adjourned: 10:11 am

Case Called: 10:48 am
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant fails to appear. Atty Austin Mort appears on behalf of Defendant. 
Date and time set for a Plea/Setencing Hearing.
Atty Mort states that he does not think that Defendant had notice of today's hearing.
COURT does not see that notice has been sent out. 
COURT does not do a warrant at this time. Parties are to reschedule the Plea Hearing with JA immediately.
Adj: 10:51 am

Jury Trial on July 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
